Why Oligonucleotides Matter
Oligonucleotides. A New Frontier in Therapeutic Innovation
Oligonucleotides are transforming medicine - offering
programmable therapies that silence genes, edit RNA,
and reach untreatable targets. With growing approvals
and a rapidly expanding pipeline, they are one of
pharma's fastest-growing commercial opportunities.
Therapeutic value:
• Ensbie gene silencing, eron slpping, RNA edting
SIRNA, antisense, aptamers - rapidly growing clinical pipelines
• Atready approved for rare diseases and oncology
Strategic importance:
• Scalable, modular, target-specific - Ideal for precision medicine
• Significant interest and increasing demand through the pipeline
But difficult to make:
• Solid-phase synthesis with dozens of precise steps
• Sequence-dependent behsvicur complicates purification and yield

Why Oligos Need Visual Intelligence
Opportunity to improve Traditional Monitoring
Oligonucleotide manufacturing is an ideal testbed
for real-time, camera-enabled insight - where
seeing more means making more.
Oligonucleotide Manufacturing: The Ideal Testbed
• Manual steps: Many tasks could introduce variability batch to batch
• Sequence effects: Every sequence behaves differently, affecting yield
• Hidden errors: Subtle changes often go unnoticed but impact results.
The Blind Spots in Lab and Scale-Up Workflows
• Traditional tools (ELN, LIMS) miss critical hurnan- and context-driven
variation
• Batch-to-batch variability often traced to small, undocumented
changes
* Human error, uncontrolled timing, environmental drift - rarely
captured
This is especially true as we scale-up, where subtle differences can
cost €000s in wasted reagents and time

The Role of Lumi
The Glue Between People, Processes, and
Instruments
Processes don't start or stop at machines - Lumi
captures what happens between them
Beyond the Instrument: Capturing Real Process Flow
• Multiple workflows, one lab: synthesis, weighing.
purification, analysis
• Dozens of numan interventions move matenal betweeni

• Traditional tools track what goes into or comes out of an
instrument — not what happens in between
• Lumi bridges the gaps - capturing context, sequence.|

In manufacturing
environment, protocol
adherence is critical.
Human error in documentation and
execution leads to costly risks in

setup, and product safety.
A single deviation can result in:
$300K - $1M+
Per-incident loss or process rework
Or even:
• Delays in drug production & regulatory filing
• Cross-contamination risks impacting
patient safety

Environmental
Monitoring - QC Sterlity
Proven ability to count colonies &
segment based on visual features.
Continuous monitoring is key to maintained sterile
manufacturing environments. Regime may include:
• Active air sampling
• Settle plates
• Surface swabs
• Operator finger dabs

2025
Manufacturing Facility
Data Monitoring
Analogue and digital visual outputs are
everywhere in manufacturing settings, often
captured manually or via custom loT.
Lumi removes that hassle by logging data
directly from screens and gauges in real time,
turning visual signals into structured data with
built-in alerts and dashboards.
